body_html:
This should now be doable with TensorFlow 1.4. See https://stackoverflow.com/questions/47276624/issue-while-loading-serving-tensorflow-model-in-java-using-estimators/47277367#47277367

You'll have to adjust the arguments to TensorFlow.loadLibrary() to correspond to the shared libraries included in the tf.contrib.tensor_forest module.

I'm closing this bug out since I believe the process described in the stackoverflow thread will work (albeit it could be made smoother). Please feel free to re-open if you run in to trouble or have comments.

Thanks!

You'll have to adjust the arguments to TensorFlow.loadLibrary() to correspond to the shared libraries included in the tf.contrib.tensor_forest module.
I'm closing this bug out since I believe the process described in the stackoverflow thread will work (albeit it could be made smoother). Please feel free to re-open if you run in to trouble or have comments.
Thanks!
body:
This should now be doable with TensorFlow 1.4. See https://stackoverflow.com/questions/47276624/issue-while-loading-serving-tensorflow-model-in-java-using-estimators/47277367#47277367

You'll have to adjust the arguments to `TensorFlow.loadLibrary()` to correspond to the shared libraries included in the `tf.contrib.tensor_forest` module.

I'm closing this bug out since I believe the process described in the stackoverflow thread will work (albeit it could be made smoother). Please feel free to re-open if you run in to trouble or have comments.

Thanks!
